attribs.current:
Weapon Proficiency (Pistols) (Pag 38 canaglia)
Weapon Proficiency (Simple Weapons)(Pag 38 canaglia)

Difesa Superiore (+1 All Def)(Pag 33)

attribs.name: Feats
attribs.current:
TALENTI

- Combattere su veicoli (pag 85)(toglie un'attacco che colpisce la nave quando dichiarato)
- Abilita' Focalizzata Informatica (pag 82)
- Abilita' Focalizzata Pilotare (pag 82)
- Attacco in corsa/Running Attack (pag 83)
- Dodge: (https://swse.fandom.com/wiki/Dodge)
During your turn, you designate an opponent and receive a +1 dodge bonus to your Reflex Defense against attacks from that opponent. You can select a new opponent on any action. A situation that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to Reflex Defense (if any) also makes you lose dodge bonuses. Also, dodge bonuses stack with each other, unlike most other types of bonuses. 
- Rebel Military Training: (https://swse.fandom.com/wiki/Rebel_Military_Training)
Whenever you use the Running Attack Feat to move both before and after making an attack, you gain a +2 dodge bonus to your Reflex Defense until the start of your next turn. 

- A Few Maneuvers (https://swse.fandom.com/wiki/A_Few_Maneuvers)
When piloting a Vehicle of Colossal size or smaller, you grant a +2 dodge bonus to your Vehicle's Reflex Defense. Furthermore, if you are the target of a missile or torpedo attack and the attack roll misses by 5 or more, the projectile self-destructs harmlessly.

attribs.name: Notes
attribs.current:
Reflex Defense: 10 + Heroic Level or Armor Bonus + Dexterity Modifier + Class Bonus + Size Modifier
Fortitude Defense: 10 + Heroic Level + Constitution Modifier + Class Bonus + Equipment Bonus
Will Defense: 10 + Heroic Level + Wisdom Modifier + Class Bonus
Medipack /roll 1d20 e un 15 fisso se >= 15 aggiugne il resto
Taglia su Kurun nella repubblica 25000 crediti vio o morto, mondo hat 50000 crediti ma vivo, consorzio schivisti 150000 crediti

EQUIPAGGIAMENTO 

- Cintura porta utensili (Capsule di cibo 3g)
- Kit Meccanico
- Cartuccia Energetica
- ComLink
- Datapad di Xora (informazioni blande)
- Crio Pack X 3 (1200 crediti)
- Cappello Rosso da pappone
- Maschera e mantello da Sith
- 3 cariche del jetpack
- Pistola razzi di segnalazioni x 2 (2d6 bruciatura)

attribs.name: Language
attribs.current: Basic, Zabrak, Twi'leki also known as Ryl,Mando'a ,Sith

attribs.name: Talents
attribs.current:
ATTITUDINI
 
Navigante Spaziale (pag 39 manuale principale) : 
- Lupo dello spazio (No penalty ai tiri per colpire quand sono sotto gravità o a gravità zero e non soffri il mal di spazio e sei considerato compotente con tutte le armi sulle astronavi)

- Predatore Stellare (+1 ai tiri per colpire se sei a bordo di una astronave)

Pirata Informatico (pag 5 del manuale 11):
- Rintracciare (puoi usare l'abilità informatica per Gather Infromation basta che abbia accesso a un arete informatica)


- Deep Space Raider (vedi pagina 47 del regolamento principale della Saga Edition o pag 5 del manuale 11):

Prerequisites: Spacehound, Starship Raider.

Sia che tu stia assumendo obiettivi militari per conto di un movimento di resistenza o che tu sia fuori per guadagno personale,  sei esperto nell'incursione di astronavi e obiettivi simili. 

Puoi utilizzare ciascuna delle seguenti azioni una volta per incontro:

© Clear a Path: 
Il tuo attacco costringe un nemico a cambiare rotta o ad allontanarsi. Devi combattere a bordo di un'astronave per usare questa azione.
Come azione standard, effettua un attacco a distanza. Se l'attacco colpisce, al suo turno successivo il tuo bersaglio deve muovere la sua 
velocità in un quadrato che non è adiacente a te. 
Se il bersaglio è un caccia stellare nemico impegnato in un combattimento di cani, il bersaglio deve invece tentare di disimpegnarsi dal combattimento di cani.

© Covering Fire:
Spremi diversi colpi mentre scappi inseguendo i nemici. Come azione a tutto tondo, se sei il pilota di un veicolo, puoi
sposta il veicolo fino a due volte la sua velocità e fai un singolo attacco a distanza con una delle armi controllate 
dal pilota in qualsiasi momento durante quella mossa-ment. Se colpisci e infliggi danno a un veicolo con questo attacco, il veicolo bersaglio subisce una penalità di -2 
ai tiri per colpire contro il tuo veicolo fino al fine del tuo prossimo turno.

© Disabling Fire:
effettua un attacco a distanza con un'arma del veicolo. 
Se lo fai questo attacco contro un veicolo e colpire e infliggere danno, puoi scegliere una delle seguenti opzioni 
che avranno effetto fino alla fine del tuo prossimo turno: 
una delle armi del bersaglio cessa di funzionare, 
la SR del bersaglio è ridotta a 0, 
l'hyperdrive del bersaglio è disabilitata o la velocità del bersaglio è ridotta a 2 quadrati.

- Electronic Forgery: You can use your Use Computer modifier in place of your Deception modifier to create a deceptive appearance with forged electronic documents.
Prerequisite: Trained in the Use Computer skill.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-Luo8rnffPyv49RW0zlM_WeaponNotes
attribs.current:
Se qualcuno cerca di romperla ho un RES + 2
Stordenti invece di fisici

attribs.name: inventory
attribs.current:
Armored Flight Suit (used) (3 armor, +2 equipment) [+3 Reflex
+1 Tempra +1 tech specialist
+4 Dexterity 
C'e' un motivo Per il master

An Armored Flight Suit provides up to 10 hours of life support, allowing its wearer to survive in the vacuum of space or any other hostile environment. ], Shipsuit [A fitted coverall can also be used as a Envirosuit in an emergency, although a separate Life Support system such as a Breath Mask is required.

A Shipsuit provides enough pockets and pouches to carry up to 24 objects of Small size and weighing no more than 1 kg each. The cumulative weight of the objects is halved for the purpose of calculating the wearer's total Carried Weight. A character wearing a Shipsuit receives a +1 Equipment bonus to his or her Fortitude Defense when resisting Extreme Temperatures. ],  All-Temperature Cloak  [This wrap-around cloak protects its wearer from the elements, providing +5 Equipment bonus to its wearer's Fortitude Defense against extreme heat or cold. ], Jet Pack(10 charge x 3 cell) [A Jet Pack is a propulsion system that a character can strap on, allowing flight over short distances. Arm and wrist controls are employed for maneuvering. Activating a Jet Pack is a Swift Action, and you gain a fly speed of 6 squares until the end of your turn. A Jet Pack has 10 charges and can be run continuously; no Swift Action is required to activate the Jet Pack on subsequent rounds of use.

Routine maneuvers do not require a Pilot check, but you must make a DC 20 Pilot check if you land after moving more than 12 squares during the same turn; on a failure you fall Prone.

A Jet Pack can lift up to 180 kg while flying. Replacement fuel cells cost 100 credits. ], Liquid Cable Dispenser (Diffusore Cavo Liquido) [Cable Dispensers contain a special liquid that instantly solidifies upon contact with either atmosphere or vacuum to form a tough, lightweight, flexible cable. The dispenser contains enough liquid for 15 meters (10 squares) of cable, and is refillable at authorized outlets. The cable has a Strength score of 28, can safely support up to 560 kg, and it can be broken with a DC 24 Strength check. ], Utility Belt(10 Pouch) Empty, Ration Pack  (x3), Medpac (x3) [Medpacs are compact packages designed to both equip and trained medic for work in the field and allow untrained individuals to apply first aid in emergencies. A Medpac contains bandages, Bacta, synthetic flesh, coagulants, stimulants, and other medicines designed to help an injured patient recover quickly.

Once you use a Medpac, its contents are expended even if your Treat Injury check is not successful. Any given creature can only benefit from the use of a Medpac once in a 24-hour period. ], Tool Kit [You need a Tool Kit to reprogram a Droid, or to Repair a damaged Droid or Vehicle. A Tool Kit also makes repairing devices much simpler.
The standard Tool Kit represents a broad collection of tools designed to take apart, analyze, modify, and rebuild almost any technological device. Most technicians personalize their Tool Kits over the course of years, but almost all contain the tools in the below table.
Many of these tools can be used as Makeshift Weapons. They all qualify as Simple Weapons, but since they aren't designed for combat, they impose a -5 penalty on attack rolls. (Droids with such Tools on Tool Mounts don't suffer these penalties, since they don't have to deal with the oddly shaped handle.) 
Tool Kit Contents:https://swse.fandom.com/wiki/Tool_Kit


], Power Pack [A Power Pack is a compact rectangular battery that fits into the grip or barrel of an energy weapon, such as a blaster, to provide the power needed to fire it. A Power Pack can be recharged with a Power Recharger.], Energy Cell  [This small battery provides power for devices, including certain types of weapons. An Energy Cell appears as a small, flat disk. An Energy Cell can be recharged with a Power Recharger. ], Glow Rod [A Glow Rod is a portable illumination device that projects a beam of light up to 6 squares. ], Comlink(Short Range), Portable Computer  [Compact and light enough to be carried in an attache case or backpack, but powerful enough to run fairly complex programs, Portable Computers are the information technology of choice for anyone who needs access to a lot of data while on the go. As such they are particularly popular with traveling business executives, military commanders in the field, and slicers.

A Portable Computer has an Intelligence score of 14. ], Bracer Computer [The Bracer Computer is a Datapad worn on the user's forearm. It performs all the same functions as the Standard Datapad, including the ability to read standard Datacards in a slot on the underside of the device. The Bracer Computer also features a holographic screen that displays information as a two-dimensional image about three centimeters above the device. Plus, the keyboard is designed to accommodate one-handed typing. The Bracer Computer is popular among those who need to conserve space with their Equipment, particularly bounty hunters.

A Bracer Computer has an Intelligence score of 12. ], Computer Interface Visor (+1 Int per tech specialist) [Worn across the eyes and connected to a computer system, the Computer Interface Visor provides the wearer with a heads-up display that displays relevant data laid over one's normal vision. A Computer Interface Visor translates complex computer algorithms into easy-to-understand symbols and words, allowing the wearer to attempt Trained-only applications of the Use Computer Skill even if Untrained. The Computer Interface Visor also provides a +2 Equipment bonus on Use Computer checks. A Computer Interface Visor cannot be worn at the same time as Armor with a helmet or any other device worn on the head. ], HiBaka 2000 Mem-Stik (x3) [Frequently used by slicers to smuggle valuable information past security guards and police, the HiBaka 2000 Mem-Stik is a tiny piece of hardware that holds a moderate amount of information without taking up too much space. Though a Mem-Stik does not have enough space to carry computer programs, it can hold simple text, image, and video data (As well as under 1 minute of Holographic data). A Mem-Stik is Fine in size, and can be hidden inside the Power Pack slot of a standard Blaster Pistol (Granting a +10 Equipment bonus to Stealth checks to hide the Mem-Stik). A blaster that has a Mem-Stik in it's Power Pack slot cannot be fired without first reinserting the Power Pack. ], Computer Spike+2 [Computer Spikes are single-use programs built into a basic piece of computer hardware that plugs directly into another computer system. Designed to bypass computer security and help improve access to protected systems, a Computer Spike interfaces with another computer system and uses untraceable programs to chip away at the target system's defenses. A Computer Spike can be activated as a Swift Action, after which it makes a single Use Computer check (With a bonus of +2 or higher, determined by it's cost and quality) that can be used only to Improve Access. All Computer Spikes are considered Illegal. ], Sensor Pack [A portable scanning device, the Sensor Pack is a bulky rectangle featuring a variety of dials and switches, a readout display, and a scanning dish. It provides general details on comm signals, life forms, and hazards within 1 kilometer. Operating a Sensor Pack requires a Standard Action, and grants a +5 circumstance bonus on your Perception checks until the end of your next turn.], Heat Sensor [Used primarily to locate fires and damaged components buried behind wall panels and beneath deck plates, a Heat Sensor is a common device in the hands of emergency crew members. A Heat Sensor monitors air temperature out to a distance of 100 meters, and presents color-coded readings on a small screen. In addition to it's normal uses, a Heat Sensor can also identify heat signatures generated by hidden creatures, making it a useful tool for rooting out stowaways or alien parasites. A Heat Sensor grants a +2 Equipment bonus to Perception checks made to detect hidden creatures, machines, or hazards that generate heat.], Stealth Field Generator [A small and unobtrusive device worn on the belt, the Stealth Field Generator emits a sound-dampening field around the wearer that makes sneaking up on an opponent easier. Additionally, the Stealth Field Generator uses technology similar to that of a Personal Energy Shield to bend light around the wearer, making them harder to see. The Stealth Field Generator grants Concealment (But not Total Concealment) to the wearer when activated. Activating a Stealth Field Generator is a Swift Action, and it lasts for the duration of the encounter, until the wearer takes damage, or until the wearer attacks or uses a Force Power, whichever comes first. A Stealth Field Generator requires a Power Pack to operate. After 5 uses, the Power Pack must be replaced. ], Sound Sponge [This small electronic device emits sound waves in frequencies well above and below the normal range of audible sound for most Species in the galaxy, using those sounds to suppress other sounds in the vicinity. A Sound Sponge muffles all sound in a 6-square radius, increasing the Perception check DC to hear noises coming from that area by 10. ], Spy Bug [This Diminutive, bioengineered insect records sights and sounds within 20 squares of it. It can be placed in a hidden area and remains there until retrieved. When the Spy Bug is retrieved, the data that it has absorbed through it's senses for the past 24 hours can be extracted. (The Yuuzhan Vong use living devices to retrieve the data, but a DC 25 Mechanics check can transmit the data via electronic connectors or Comlink).

A Spy Bug functions as a Holorecorder Unit. A Spy Bug registers as a life form on sensors, not as an electronic device. ], Veridicator [Worn as an inconspicuous bracelet, the Veridicator uses sophisticated sensors to monitor a target's heart rate, pupil dilation, perspiration, and other involuntary stress responses. It compares this information to it's internal database, determining the emotional state of the target and indicating if he or she is lying. The Veridicator then relays this information to the wearer as a series of pulses, temperature variations, or vibrations.

Once activated, the Veridicator needs a full round to acquire the data from a single target within 6 squares of the user. Then the Veridicator provides a +5 bonus to Perception checks for the purpose of Sensing Deception or Sensing Influence or for Gambling against other players in games such as sabacc. The Veridicator can be programmed for only a single Species at a time. Changing the settings requires a DC 10 Use Computer check. ], Cheater(1 upgrade slot) [A Cheater is a hand-held device designed to allow you to cheat at the popular Gambling game of Sabacc. Because they are Illegal (And likely to get you killed to boot), Cheaters usually are disguised and added to another piece of functional Equipment.

While you use a Cheater, you gain a +2 Equipment bonus on the Wisdom check made to determine the outcome of Gambling. You have to make a Stealth check opposed by any observers' Perception checks to conceal the use of a Cheater, but you gain a bonus on your check determined by the objects size. (Generally, Cheaters are placed in Fine-sized devices such as Credit Chips or Comlinks, granting a +10 size bonus on Stealth checks to conceal their use.) However, if anyone ever beats your Wisdom check in a Sabacc game by 6 or more, that person realizes you must be cheating somehow (Though they won't know exactly how- often leading to a demand for a search of your possessions). ], Granate (Frammentazione) (x6) [Area di attacco (2x2), 4d6, type Blast], Granate (Fumogene) (x2) [Area di attacco (2x2), 4d6, type Blast], Force Point Extra, OxigenTank (24 h) [24h of oxygen ], Granate Ioniche (x3)

+1 Tempra +1 tech specialist
+4 Dexterity

attribs.name: StarshipManeuvers
attribs.current:
PiLotare [Des] Pag 72 Manuale Principale

Questa abilità viene usata per azionare un veicolo. Il normale utilizzo di un veicolo non richiede alcuna prova di abilità o particolare addestramento; la prova è invece necessaria in caso di manovre evasive o acrobatiche.

Ogni volta che il personaggio effettua una prova di Pilotare, deve applicare al tiro il modificatore di taglia del veicolo (vedi la Tabella 10-1: “Taglia dei veicoli", pagina 166).

Aumentare velocità del veicolo (solo con addestramento):

Il personaggio può effettuare una prova di Pilotare con CD 20 come azione veloce per spingere le prestazioni del suo veicolo oltre i suoi limiti normali. (non è possibile prendere 10 in questa prova.) Se la prova fallisce, la velocità del veicolo non aumenta e il mezzo scende di -1 casella sulla tabella delle condizioni (vedi “Condizioni”, pagina 148).
Se il personaggio supera la prova, la velocità del veicolo aumenta di 1 quadretto fino all'inizio del suo turno successivo. Per ogni 5 punti di margine di cui il risultato supera la CD della prova, la velocità del veicolo aumenta di 1 ulteriore quadretto.

Duello aerospaziale: 

Quando manovra un veicolo volante, il personaggio può effettuare una prova di Pilotare come azione standard per ingaggiare un combattimento ravvicinato in aria o nello spazio (vedi “Duello aerospaziale”, pagina 171).

Evitare collisione: 

Il personaggio può effettuare una prova di Pilotare con CD 15 come reazione per ridurre 0 negare i danni di una collisione (vedi "Evitare collisioni", pagina 173).

Impegnare il nemico (solo con addestramento): 

Quando pilota impegna un vei- colo in combattimento, il personaggio può effettuare una prova di Pilotare al posto di una prova di Iniziativa per determinare il suo posto nell'ordine di iniziativa.

Speronamento:

L'eroe può effettuare una prova di Pilotare come parte di un'azione di round completo per entrare volontariamente in collisione con un bersaglio (vedi "Speronamento", pagina 172).

Speciale: 

È possibile prendere 10 quando si effettua una prova di Pilotare, tranne quando si tenta di aumentare la velocità di un veicolo. Non è consentito prendere 20 alle prove di Pilotare.

- Combattere su veicoli (pag 85)(toglie un'attacco che colpisce la nave quando dichiarato)

- Deep Space Raider (vedi pagina 47 del regolamento principale della Saga Edition)(pag 5 dle documento classi base):

Prerequisites: Spacehound, Starship Raider.

Sia che tu stia assumendo obiettivi militari per conto di un movimento di resistenza o che tu sia fuori per guadagno personale,  sei esperto nell'incursione di astronavi e obiettivi simili. 

Puoi utilizzare ciascuna delle seguenti azioni una volta per incontro:

© Clear a Path: 
Il tuo attacco costringe un nemico a cambiare rotta o ad allontanarsi. Devi combattere a bordo di un'astronave per usare questa azione.
Come azione standard, effettua un attacco a distanza. Se l'attacco colpisce, al suo turno successivo il tuo bersaglio deve muovere la sua 
velocità in un quadrato che non è adiacente a te. 
Se il bersaglio è un caccia stellare nemico impegnato in un combattimento di cani, il bersaglio deve invece tentare di disimpegnarsi dal combattimento di cani.

© Covering Fire:
Spremi diversi colpi mentre scappi inseguendo i nemici. Come azione a tutto tondo, se sei il pilota di un veicolo, puoi
sposta il veicolo fino a due volte la sua velocità e fai un singolo attacco a distanza con una delle armi controllate 
dal pilota in qualsiasi momento durante quella mossa-ment. Se colpisci e infliggi danno a un veicolo con questo attacco, il veicolo bersaglio subisce una penalità di -2 
ai tiri per colpire contro il tuo veicolo fino al fine del tuo prossimo turno.

© Disabling Fire:
effettua un attacco a distanza con un'arma del veicolo. 
Se lo fai questo attacco contro un veicolo e colpire e infliggere danno, puoi scegliere una delle seguenti opzioni 
che avranno effetto fino alla fine del tuo prossimo turno: 
una delle armi del bersaglio cessa di funzionare, 
la SR del bersaglio è ridotta a 0, 
l'hyperdrive del bersaglio è disabilitata o la velocità del bersaglio è ridotta a 2 quadrati.

Appunti:
Pilota addestrato: +2 nel colpire a tutit i tiri con l'astronave

Azione standard concentrarsi sulla difensiva : +2 sui rilfessi , se decidi di no attacaacre +5 sui riflessi , ma -10 agli artigleri a bordo.

Corsa d'attacco: almeno 2 quadretti astronave, +2 al colpire , in base a quanto sei lontano

A Stealth Field Generator requires a Power Pack to operate. After 5 uses, the Power Pack must be replaced. ], Sound Sponge [This small electronic device emits sound waves in frequencies well above and below the normal range of audible sound for most Species in the galaxy, using those sounds to suppress other sounds in the vicinity. A Sound Sponge muffles all sound in a 6-square radius, increasing the Perception check DC to hear noises coming from that area by 10. ], Spy Bug [This Diminutive, bioengineered insect records sights and sounds within 20 squares of it. It can be placed in a hidden area and remains there until retrieved. When the Spy Bug is retrieved, the data that it has absorbed through it's senses for the past 24 hours can be extracted. (The Yuuzhan Vong use living devices to retrieve the data, but a DC 25 Mechanics check can transmit the data via electronic connectors or Comlink).

A Spy Bug functions as a Holorecorder Unit. A Spy Bug registers as a life form on sensors, not as an electronic device. ], Veridicator [Worn as an inconspicuous bracelet, the Veridicator uses sophisticated sensors to monitor a target's heart rate, pupil dilation, perspiration, and other involuntary stress responses. It compares this information to it's internal database, determining the emotional state of the target and indicating if he or she is lying. The Veridicator then relays this information to the wearer as a series of pulses, temperature variations, or vibrations.

Once activated, the Veridicator needs a full round to acquire the data from a single target within 6 squares of the user. Then the Veridicator provides a +5 bonus to Perception checks for the purpose of Sensing Deception or Sensing Influence or for Gambling against other players in games such as sabacc. The Veridicator can be programmed for only a single Species at a time. Changing the settings requires a DC 10 Use Computer check. ], Cheater(1 upgrade slot) [A Cheater is a hand-held device designed to allow you to cheat at the popular Gambling game of Sabacc. Because they are Illegal (And likely to get you killed to boot), Cheaters usually are disguised and added to another piece of functional Equipment.

While you use a Cheater, you gain a +2 Equipment bonus on the Wisdom check made to determine the outcome of Gambling. You have to make a Stealth check opposed by any observers' Perception checks to conceal the use of a Cheater, but you gain a bonus on your check determined by the objects size. (Generally, Cheaters are placed in Fine-sized devices such as Credit Chips or Comlinks, granting a +10 size bonus on Stealth checks to conceal their use.) However, if anyone ever beats your Wisdom check in a Sabacc game by 6 or more, that person realizes you must be cheating somehow (Though they won't know exactly how- often leading to a demand for a search of your possessions). ], Granate (Frammentazione) (x6) [Area di attacco (2x2), 4d6, type Blast], Granate (Fumogene) (x2) [Area di attacco (2x2), 4d6, type Blast], Force Point Extra, OxigenTank (24 h) [24h of oxygen ], Granate Ioniche (x3)

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2nyUZ9Ci0h3b0pMdcV_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current: This wrap-around cloak protects its wearer from the elements, providing +5 Equipment bonus to its wearer's Fortitude Defense against extreme heat or cold.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2nyoF1hxpqyhEvvOI2_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current:
A Jet Pack is a propulsion system that a character can strap on, allowing flight over short distances. Arm and wrist controls are employed for maneuvering. Activating a Jet Pack is a Swift Action, and you gain a fly speed of 6 squares until the end of your turn. A Jet Pack has 10 charges and can be run continuously; no Swift Action is required to activate the Jet Pack on subsequent rounds of use.

Routine maneuvers do not require a Pilot check, but you must make a DC 20 Pilot check if you land after moving more than 12 squares during the same turn; on a failure you fall Prone.

A Jet Pack can lift up to 180 kg while flying. Replacement fuel cells cost 100 credits.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2nzPv7hh09YOTnuPOT_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current: Cable Dispensers contain a special liquid that instantly solidifies upon contact with either atmosphere or vacuum to form a tough, lightweight, flexible cable. The dispenser contains enough liquid for 15 meters (10 squares) of cable, and is refillable at authorized outlets. The cable has a Strength score of 28, can safely support up to 560 kg, and it can be broken with a DC 24 Strength check.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o-4q2BW1A4HBL2Tfn_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current:
Medpacs are compact packages designed to both equip and trained medic for work in the field and allow untrained individuals to apply first aid in emergencies. A Medpac contains bandages, Bacta, synthetic flesh, coagulants, stimulants, and other medicines designed to help an injured patient recover quickly.

Once you use a Medpac, its contents are expended even if your Treat Injury check is not successful. Any given creature can only benefit from the use of a Medpac once in a 24-hour period.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o-HRDWV5-ag2Ya7fh_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current:
You need a Tool Kit to reprogram a Droid, or to Repair a damaged Droid or Vehicle. A Tool Kit also makes repairing devices much simpler.
The standard Tool Kit represents a broad collection of tools designed to take apart, analyze, modify, and rebuild almost any technological device. Most technicians personalize their Tool Kits over the course of years, but almost all contain the tools in the below table.
Many of these tools can be used as Makeshift Weapons. They all qualify as Simple Weapons, but since they aren't designed for combat, they impose a -5 penalty on attack rolls. (Droids with such Tools on Tool Mounts don't suffer these penalties, since they don't have to deal with the oddly shaped handle.) 
Tool Kit Contents:https://swse.fandom.com/wiki/Tool_Kit

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o-s7W8FysMNK2bQRm_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current: A Power Pack is a compact rectangular battery that fits into the grip or barrel of an energy weapon, such as a blaster, to provide the power needed to fire it. A Power Pack can be recharged with a Power Recharger.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o02Zkgrg52lZ98Hdw_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current: This small battery provides power for devices, including certain types of weapons. An Energy Cell appears as a small, flat disk. An Energy Cell can be recharged with a Power Recharger.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o0DNzmDvZzdfMJyQn_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current: A Glow Rod is a portable illumination device that projects a beam of light up to 6 squares.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o1CwYTEZbnapbGPZj_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current:
Compact and light enough to be carried in an attache case or backpack, but powerful enough to run fairly complex programs, Portable Computers are the information technology of choice for anyone who needs access to a lot of data while on the go. As such they are particularly popular with traveling business executives, military commanders in the field, and slicers.

A Portable Computer has an Intelligence score of 14.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o1g-mbBPAVRkodO8I_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current:
The Bracer Computer is a Datapad worn on the user's forearm. It performs all the same functions as the Standard Datapad, including the ability to read standard Datacards in a slot on the underside of the device. The Bracer Computer also features a holographic screen that displays information as a two-dimensional image about three centimeters above the device. Plus, the keyboard is designed to accommodate one-handed typing. The Bracer Computer is popular among those who need to conserve space with their Equipment, particularly bounty hunters.

A Bracer Computer has an Intelligence score of 12.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o1sCsqZv7XLetAxiL_EquipmentItem
attribs.current: Computer Interface Visor (+1 Int per tech specialist)

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o1sCsqZv7XLetAxiL_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current: Worn across the eyes and connected to a computer system, the Computer Interface Visor provides the wearer with a heads-up display that displays relevant data laid over one's normal vision. A Computer Interface Visor translates complex computer algorithms into easy-to-understand symbols and words, allowing the wearer to attempt Trained-only applications of the Use Computer Skill even if Untrained. The Computer Interface Visor also provides a +2 Equipment bonus on Use Computer checks. A Computer Interface Visor cannot be worn at the same time as Armor with a helmet or any other device worn on the head.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o2dU6Q8xMa0By73Z3_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current: Frequently used by slicers to smuggle valuable information past security guards and police, the HiBaka 2000 Mem-Stik is a tiny piece of hardware that holds a moderate amount of information without taking up too much space. Though a Mem-Stik does not have enough space to carry computer programs, it can hold simple text, image, and video data (As well as under 1 minute of Holographic data). A Mem-Stik is Fine in size, and can be hidden inside the Power Pack slot of a standard Blaster Pistol (Granting a +10 Equipment bonus to Stealth checks to hide the Mem-Stik). A blaster that has a Mem-Stik in it's Power Pack slot cannot be fired without first reinserting the Power Pack.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o2wsMhqUxAQE4L4YU_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current: Computer Spikes are single-use programs built into a basic piece of computer hardware that plugs directly into another computer system. Designed to bypass computer security and help improve access to protected systems, a Computer Spike interfaces with another computer system and uses untraceable programs to chip away at the target system's defenses. A Computer Spike can be activated as a Swift Action, after which it makes a single Use Computer check (With a bonus of +2 or higher, determined by it's cost and quality) that can be used only to Improve Access. All Computer Spikes are considered Illegal.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o3Q0PZhP7Xo8UMbvb_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current: A portable scanning device, the Sensor Pack is a bulky rectangle featuring a variety of dials and switches, a readout display, and a scanning dish. It provides general details on comm signals, life forms, and hazards within 1 kilometer. Operating a Sensor Pack requires a Standard Action, and grants a +5 circumstance bonus on your Perception checks until the end of your next turn.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o3eGyoFnMGcRvChLg_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current: Used primarily to locate fires and damaged components buried behind wall panels and beneath deck plates, a Heat Sensor is a common device in the hands of emergency crew members. A Heat Sensor monitors air temperature out to a distance of 100 meters, and presents color-coded readings on a small screen. In addition to it's normal uses, a Heat Sensor can also identify heat signatures generated by hidden creatures, making it a useful tool for rooting out stowaways or alien parasites. A Heat Sensor grants a +2 Equipment bonus to Perception checks made to detect hidden creatures, machines, or hazards that generate heat.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o3qIH3q9BmZjVuTn6_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current: A small and unobtrusive device worn on the belt, the Stealth Field Generator emits a sound-dampening field around the wearer that makes sneaking up on an opponent easier. Additionally, the Stealth Field Generator uses technology similar to that of a Personal Energy Shield to bend light around the wearer, making them harder to see. The Stealth Field Generator grants Concealment (But not Total Concealment) to the wearer when activated. Activating a Stealth Field Generator is a Swift Action, and it lasts for the duration of the encounter, until the wearer takes damage, or until the wearer attacks or uses a Force Power, whichever comes first. A Stealth Field Generator requires a Power Pack to operate. After 5 uses, the Power Pack must be replaced.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o3qIH3q9BmZjVuTn6_EquipmentLocation
attribs.current: -2 Attack roll e -5 perception Vs te

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o4YKWZXP2JUSQ1XK-_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current: This small electronic device emits sound waves in frequencies well above and below the normal range of audible sound for most Species in the galaxy, using those sounds to suppress other sounds in the vicinity. A Sound Sponge muffles all sound in a 6-square radius, increasing the Perception check DC to hear noises coming from that area by 10.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o4jBPf-fJyvherBkb_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current:
This Diminutive, bioengineered insect records sights and sounds within 20 squares of it. It can be placed in a hidden area and remains there until retrieved. When the Spy Bug is retrieved, the data that it has absorbed through it's senses for the past 24 hours can be extracted. (The Yuuzhan Vong use living devices to retrieve the data, but a DC 25 Mechanics check can transmit the data via electronic connectors or Comlink).

A Spy Bug functions as a Holorecorder Unit. A Spy Bug registers as a life form on sensors, not as an electronic device.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2o6NUB9VkKyzcC8Az8_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current:
Worn as an inconspicuous bracelet, the Veridicator uses sophisticated sensors to monitor a target's heart rate, pupil dilation, perspiration, and other involuntary stress responses. It compares this information to it's internal database, determining the emotional state of the target and indicating if he or she is lying. The Veridicator then relays this information to the wearer as a series of pulses, temperature variations, or vibrations.

Once activated, the Veridicator needs a full round to acquire the data from a single target within 6 squares of the user. Then the Veridicator provides a +5 bonus to Perception checks for the purpose of Sensing Deception or Sensing Influence or for Gambling against other players in games such as sabacc. The Veridicator can be programmed for only a single Species at a time. Changing the settings requires a DC 10 Use Computer check.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2oDkwzehZmvnQ8E9oa_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current:
A Cheater is a hand-held device designed to allow you to cheat at the popular Gambling game of Sabacc. Because they are Illegal (And likely to get you killed to boot), Cheaters usually are disguised and added to another piece of functional Equipment.

While you use a Cheater, you gain a +2 Equipment bonus on the Wisdom check made to determine the outcome of Gambling. You have to make a Stealth check opposed by any observers' Perception checks to conceal the use of a Cheater, but you gain a bonus on your check determined by the objects size. (Generally, Cheaters are placed in Fine-sized devices such as Credit Chips or Comlinks, granting a +10 size bonus on Stealth checks to conceal their use.) However, if anyone ever beats your Wisdom check in a Sabacc game by 6 or more, that person realizes you must be cheating somehow (Though they won't know exactly how- often leading to a demand for a search of your possessions).

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-M2Fijl93ea0XePCSZTo_EquipmentNotes
attribs.current:
A fitted coverall can also be used as a Envirosuit in an emergency, although a separate Life Support system such as a Breath Mask is required.

A Shipsuit provides enough pockets and pouches to carry up to 24 objects of Small size and weighing no more than 1 kg each. The cumulative weight of the objects is halved for the purpose of calculating the wearer's total Carried Weight. A character wearing a Shipsuit receives a +1 Equipment bonus to his or her Fortitude Defense when resisting Extreme Temperatures.

attribs.name: AttackOptions
attribs.current:
C-Wing Ugly : 50/100
Damage Reduction: 10;  
Shield Rating: 30; (30 current)
Nemici uccisi: 10
Per colpire: /roll 1d20 + 4  +1 +1 +5
